intro: Dichapetalum keniense, commonly known as the Kenyan dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branching. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
